wpPost.title: How to use Section.xml file in Magento 2
wpPost.content:
Magento 2 is a robust e-commerce platform that offers developers a versatile and adaptable framework to construct online stores. Among its essential components, Magento 2 boasts a sophisticated layout system that permits developers to create pages and blocks with specific content and formatting. To define the structure and content of a page or block, developers employ XML files known as layout files. In this blog post, we will examine such layout files and learn how to use section.xml file in Magento 2.

What is the Section.xml file in Magento 2?

The section.xml file is responsible for defining the content and structure of sections present in a page or block. These sections act as containers for holding related content like customer data, order details, or product information, and they can have attributes like title or description.

To locate the section.xml file in a Magento 2 module, you need to navigate to the app/code/[Vendor]/[Module]/view/frontend/layout directory. In most cases, developers use this layout file in conjunction with other layout files like default.xml, catalog_product_view.xml, or page.xml to define the layout and content of a block or page.

How to use Section.xml file in Magento 2?

To use the section.xml file in Magento 2, follow these steps:

Step 1: Create the section.xml file

Create a new file called section.xml in the app/code/[Vendor]/[Module]/view/frontend/layout directory of your Magento 2 module. The file should have the following basic structure:

xml

<?xml version="1.0"?>

<page xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation="urn:magento:framework:View/Layout/etc/page_configuration.xsd">

    <body>

        <!-- Define sections here -->

    </body>

</page>

Step 2: Define the sections

Inside the <body> tag, you can define one or more sections using the <referenceContainer> tag. The <referenceContainer> tag has the following attributes:

– name: The name of the container. This is used to reference the container from other layout files or templates.

 – htmlClass: The CSS class to be applied to the container.

 – htmlId: The ID to be assigned to the container.

Here is an example of a section definition:

php

<referenceContainer name="product.info.main">

    <container name="product.info.custom" htmlClass="product-info-custom" htmlId="product-info-custom" after="product.info.price">

        <argument name="title" xsi:type="string">Custom Section</argument>

        <argument name="sort_order" xsi:type="number">50</argument>

    </container>

</referenceContainer>

This example creates a new section called “product.info.custom” within the “product.info.main” container. The section has a CSS class of “product-info-custom” and an ID of “product-info-custom”. It is positioned after the “product.info.price” container. The section also has two arguments:

– title: The title of the section.

– sort_order: The order in which the section appears within its parent container.

Step 3: Use the section in a template

To display the content of a section in a template, you can use the getChildHtml() method. This method takes the name of the section container as a parameter and returns the HTML content of the section. Here is an example:

php

<div class="product-info-custom-wrapper">

    <?php echo $block->getChildHtml('product.info.custom') ?>

</div>

This example displays the content of the “product.info.custom” section within a div element with a CSS class of “product-info-custom-wrapper”.

Conclusion

The section file is an essential tool for Magento 2 developers. It allows them to define the structure and content of sections within a page or block, and customize them with specific titles, descriptions, and attributes using the <referenceContainer> tag and its attributes. These sections can be easily referenced in templates using the getChildHtml() method to display their content.

By utilizing the section.xml file in Magento 2, developers can create customized sections that display important information such as product information, customer data, or order details. They can also generate XML and HTML Sitemaps. Defining the structure and content of these sections can greatly enhance the functionality of online stores, improve website navigation, and provide a better user experience for customers.

In conclusion, the section.xml file is a valuable tool for Magento 2 developers who want to create highly customized and efficient e-commerce stores. Mastery of its use can lead to the creation of exceptional online stores that are well structured, easy to navigate, and provide a superior customer experience.
